intro: Acostaea tenax, commonly known as the stiff false waterplantain, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the family Alismataceae. It is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves that are typically arranged in a basal rosette. The plant produces small, white or pale green flowers that are clustered in spadices, typical of the Araceae family. Acostaea tenax is often found in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of ponds, where it thrives in moist to aquatic conditions. It plays a role in wetland ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
